TI Ablation threshold measurements and surface modifications of 193 nm
   laser irradiated 4H-SiC
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID SILICON-CARBIDE; SEMICONDUCTOR; EVAPORATION; GRAPHENE; GROWTH; DEFECT;
   FILMS
AB We report laser ablation experiments on polished 4H-SiC wafers using an 193 nm ArF laser over a fluence range of mJ cm(-2) -5000 mJ cm(-2). An onset of material modification was measured at a laser fluence of 925 +/- 80 mJ cm(-2,) and a concomitant etch rate of similar to 200 pm per pulse. Laser ablation sites have been analysed using optical microscopy, scanning electron microscopy, Raman microscopy and white light interferometry. Finite element simulations using COMSOL (TM) Metaphysics, 5.3 have been used to calculate laser induced temperature rise of 4H-SiC as a function of laser fluence. The laser fluence required to reach the melting points of silicon, silicon carbide and carbon have been calculated and correspond to similar to 970, 1950, 2600 mJ cm(-2) respectively. Two different surface modifications are observed. At a laser fluence in the region of 1.0 J cm(-2) the irradiated site removed material forming a uniform crater. At a higher laser fluence, in the region of 2700 mJ cm(-2), nodule-like structures form on the base of the ablation crater. The dissociation of laser irradiated 4H-SiC is briefly discussed.
C1 [Mohammed, A. F.; Al-Jarwany, Q. A.; Clarke, A. J.; Kemp, N. T.; Walton, C. D.] Hull Univ, Sch Math & Phys Sci, Kingston Upon Hull HU6 7RX, N Humberside, England.
   [Mohammed, A. F.] Univ Technol Baghdad, Appl Phys Dept, Baghdad, Iraq.
   [Al-Jarwany, Q. A.] Univ Babylon, Mat Engn Coll, Babylon, Iraq.
   [Amaral, T. M.] Leibniz Inst New Mat, Campus D2 2, D-66123 Saarbrucken, Germany.
   [Lawrence, J.] Coventry Univ, Sch Mech Aerosp & Automot Engn, Fac Engn Environm & Comp, Priory St, Coventry, W Midlands, England.
RP Walton, CD (reprint author), Hull Univ, Sch Math & Phys Sci, Kingston Upon Hull HU6 7RX, N Humberside, England.
EM C.D.Walton@hull.ac.uk

TI Hetero-binuclear superhalogen anions with cyanide and/or isocyanide as
   ligands
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Superhalogen; Pseudohalogen ligand; Vertical electron detachment energy;
   Extra electron distribution; Theoretical calculation
ID AB-INITIO; PHOTOELECTRON-SPECTROSCOPY; BUILDING-BLOCKS; CL; BR;
   ENERGIES; MG; CA
AB A series of hetero-binuclear superhalogen anions involving cyanide and/or isocyanide ligands have been theoretically characterized. Large VDEs (5.831-8.409 eV) confirm the superhalogen nature of these anions. A smaller M or a larger M' central atom can bring a larger VDE value to such anions. The LiMgL4--B (L = CN/NC) isomer possesses the largest VDE value because its extra electron is evenly shared by the three bridging L ligands. For the other anions, the isomers possess relatively larger VDE values when the extra electron is localized on the terminal cyanide instead of isocyanide ligand.
C1 [Yang, Hui; Li, Ying; He, Hui-Min; Yu, Dan; Wu, Di; Li, Zhi-Ru] Jilin Univ, Inst Theoret Chem, Lab Theoret & Computat Chem, Changchun 130023, Jilin, Peoples R China.

TI Theoretical simulation of the Q(x)-band absorption and fluorescence
   spectra of cis-isobacteriochlorin: Including the Duschinsky and
   Herzberg-Teller effects
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE cis-Isobacteriochlorin; Absorption and fluorescence spectra; Vibronic
   fine-structures; Duschinsky effect; Herzberg-Teller effect
ID FREE-BASE PORPHYRIN; PI-CATION RADICALS; HARTREE-FOCK;
   ADJUSTABLE-PARAMETERS; SIROHEME; CHLORIN; BACTERIOCHLORIN;
   PHTHALOCYANINE; DERIVATIVES; FORMULA
AB The characteristics of the low-lying electronic states of cis-isobacteriochlorin were investigated by Density Functional Theory and its time-dependent extension. The high-resolved absorption and fluorescence spectra were simulated in the framework of the Herzberg-Teller approximation with the inclusion of the normal mode mixing effect. The simulated spectra were in accordance with the experimental findings. Our theoretical simulations allowed to identify the experimental bands and to assign them to the specific vibrational transitions. The individual Herzberg-Teller and Duschinsky effects were investigated separately and their respective contribution on the vibrational intensity changes of different normal modes were clarified.
C1 [Dong, Yajing; Zheng, Wenzhi; Fan, Xiaoting; Zheng, Xianfeng; Liang, Jun] Anhui Normal Univ, Anhui Prov Key Lab Optoelect Mat Sci & Technol, Wuhu 241000, Peoples R China.

TI New environment-sensitive bis-dansyl molecular probes bearing alkyl
   diamine linkers: Emissive features and interaction with cyclodextrins
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Bis-dansyl fluorophores; Fluorescence spectroscopy; Dual fluorescence;
   Intramolecular charge transfer; Cyclodextrin
ID INTRAMOLECULAR CHARGE-TRANSFER; BETA-CYCLODEXTRIN; DUAL FLUORESCENCE;
   ELECTRON-TRANSFER; PHOTOPHYSICAL PROPERTIES; AMINO-ACIDS; BEHAVIOR;
   SOLVENT; STATE; COMPLEXATION
AB Bis-dansyl fluorescent probes bearing aliphatic diamine linkers of increasing length (2DA(1.n), n = 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12) were synthesized, and their emissive characteristics in solvents and in cyclodextrin solutions were discussed. Dual emission from locally excited (LE) and intramolecular charge transfer (CT) excited states was observed. The LE/CT relative magnitude is sensitive to solvent polarity and linker length. In water, the CT or LE state is favoured for short chain or long chain probes, respectively. The LE/CT relative magnitude also depends on the CD type: 2-hydroxypropyl-beta-CD favours the CT state, while beta- and gamma-CD stabilise the LE state.

TI A gas sensor based on Ga-doped SnO2 porous microflowers for detecting
   formaldehyde at low temperature
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Ga-doped SnO2 porous microflowers; Gas sensor; Hydrothermal;
   Formaldehyde
ID SENSING PROPERTIES; HYDROTHERMAL SYNTHESIS; MICROSPHERES;
   NANOSTRUCTURES; NANOFIBERS; IN2O3; NANOPARTICLES; SENSITIVITY;
   SELECTIVITY; MICROCUBES
AB Ga-doped and undoped SnO2 porous microflowers (SPMs) were synthesized by a facile hydrothermal method. The presence of Ga in the SPMs and their structure was determined by X-ray powder diffraction (XRD), energy-dispersive spectroscopy (EDS), X-ray photoelectric spectroscopy (XPS) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Compared with the pure SPM sensor, the 3 wt% Ga-doped SPM sensor exhibits a lower detection limit (3.0/ 0.1 ppm) and improved sensitivity (95.8/50 ppm) to formaldehyde at 230 degrees C, which is 4.5 times greater than the pure SPM sensor (21.2/50 ppm). Furthermore, the Ga-doped sensor shows a short response-recovery time (3/ 39 s) and good selectivity for formaldehyde.
C1 [Du, Liting; Li, Haiying; Li, Shuo; Liu, Li; Li, Yu; Gong, Yimin; Cheng, Yali; Zeng, Xiangan] Jilin Univ, Coll Phys, State Key Lab Superhard Mat, Changchun 130012, Jilin, Peoples R China.
   [Xu, Suyan] Dehui Secondary Vocat & Tech Sch, Changchun 130300, Jilin, Peoples R China.

AU Mordkovich, VZ
   Lugvishchuk, DS
   Mitberg, EB

AF Mordkovich, V. Z.

   Perezhogin, I. A.
   Kirichenko, A. N.
TI Formation of concentric shell carbon by homogeneous partial oxidation of
   methane
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Carbon onion; Concwntric shell; Partial oxidation; Ovary
AB It has been shown that the carbon soot produced as a byproduct of partial oxidation of methane consists of carbon nanoparticles of almost ideal spherical morphology and perfect concentric onion-like structure. The particles are unusually big for carbon onions and have outer diameter of 10-50 nm while the inner cage is rather typical for onions and has diameter below 1 nm. The concentric graphitic structure and spherical symmetry along with the absence of amorphous carbon are confirmed by transmission electron microscopy, electron diffraction, EDX spectroscopy and Raman investigation. The spherical particles get deposited on a wall of a partial oxidation reactor as loose particles embedded in a low density organic ovary, which can be detected by its luminescence or by cautious electron microscopy imaging. It is important that unlike literature reports on giant onions, the carbon deposit was dominated by these giant spheres. This process may be considered as a prototype for a production method for giant concentric shell carbon particle black.
C1 [Mordkovich, V. Z.; Lugvishchuk, D. S.; Mitberg, E. B.; Kulnitskiy, B. A.; Perezhogin, I. A.; Kirichenko, A. N.] Technol Inst Superhard & Novel Carbon Mat, Moscow 108840, Russia.
   [Mordkovich, V. Z.; Mitberg, E. B.] INFRA Technol Ltd, Moscow 125009, Russia.
RP Mordkovich, VZ (reprint author), Technol Inst Superhard & Novel Carbon Mat, Moscow 108840, Russia.
EM mordkovich@tisnum.ru

   Mitberg, Eduard/U-6535-2019; Lugvishchuk, Dmitry/S-8569-2019

   Hu, Jinyuan
   Xu, Fei
TI Stabilizing effects of pairwise salt bridges between acidic and basic
   residues in a collagen heterotrimer
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Collagen; Salt bridge; Energetic contribution; Prediction of stability
ID STRUCTURAL INSIGHTS; MOLECULAR-STRUCTURE; CHAIN; DESIGN; MUTATIONS;
   PEPTIDE; PROTEIN
AB Collagen is composed of three chains, which wind into triple helices. As there are high percentages of acidic and basic residues in natural collagen, mechanisms of how salt bridges could modulate the trimerization have been received much attention. Sixteen pairwise salt bridges were constructed in a collagen heterotrimer abc, making an energetic-contribution library for collagen stability. The local stability of type I collagen was predicted from the library. Separation between the stabilizing and ligand-binding regions of type I collagen suggests that there be a balance between overall stability to maintain triple helices and local instability relevant to biological functions.
C1 [Zheng, Hongning; Liu, Han; Hu, Jinyuan; Xu, Fei] Jiangnan Univ, Sch Biotechnol, Key Lab Carbohydrate Chem & Biotechnol, Minist Educ, 1800 Lihu Ave, Wuxi 214122, Peoples R China.
RP Xu, F (reprint author), Jiangnan Univ, Sch Biotechnol, Key Lab Carbohydrate Chem & Biotechnol, Minist Educ, 1800 Lihu Ave, Wuxi 214122, Peoples R China.
EM feixu@jiangnan.edu.cn

TI Green synthesized silver nanoparticles @ zeolite type A hybridized with
   carbon ceramic, AgZA-CCE, as a new nano-electrocatalyst for detection of
   ultra-trace amounts of rutin
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Rutin; Ag nanoparticles; Zeolite type A; Carbon ceramic electrode; Green
   synthesis
ID CAPILLARY-ELECTROPHORESIS; FLUOROMETRIC DETECTIONS; AMPEROMETRIC
   DETECTION; COMPOSITE ELECTRODES; FLAVONOIDS; VOLTAMMETRY; EXTRACTION;
   QUERCETIN; ACID
AB In this study, Ag nanoparticles were green synthesized and a novel nano Ag doped zeolite A modified carbon ceramic electrode (AgZA-CCE) was fabricated. It was applied for the determination of rutin with high sensitivity. A substantial (550 mV) decrease in the overvoltage of rutin oxidation reaction was observed using the AgZA-CCE. The calibration graph was linear over the concentration range of 0.005-0.21 mu M and the detection limit was estimated 0.47 nM. The resulted diffusion coefficient was equal to 4.22 x 10(-7) cm(2) s(-1) . The proposed electrode was used for the determination of rutin in real samples with satisfactory results.
C1 [Rohani, T.; Mohammadi, S. Z.; Karimi, M. A.; Amini, S.] Payame Noor Univ, Dept Chem, POB 19395-4697, Tehran, Iran.
RP Rohani, T (reprint author), Payame Noor Univ, Dept Chem, POB 19395-4697, Tehran, Iran.
EM th_rohani@yahoo.com

AU Sinha, N

   Antony, Bobby
TI Theoretical study of positron scattering from pentane isomers
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE Positron scattering; Isomeric effect; Total cross section; Integral
   elastic cross section; Differential cross section
ID TOTAL CROSS-SECTIONS; ELECTRON-SCATTERING; INTERMEDIATE; MOLECULES;
   ATOMS; HE
AB This work aims to probe isomeric effect in case of positron scattering. In this pursuit, we have chosen pentane (C5H12) as the target molecule. The structural isomers of pentane offers a perfect prototype to investigate isomeric effect and thus may give further knowledge into the role of the geometrical arrangements of atoms in a target molecule during the positron scattering process. The grand total, integral elastic and differential cross section are reported using the modified spherical complex optical potential (mSCOP) method. The cross sections do not exhibit isomeric effect, which is in accordance with the experimental observation.
C1 [Sinha, Nidhi; Antony, Bobby] Indian Sch Mines, Indian Inst Technol, Atom & Mol Phys Lab, Dept Appl Phys, Dhanbad 826004, Jharkhand, India.
RP Antony, B (reprint author), Indian Sch Mines, Indian Inst Technol, Atom & Mol Phys Lab, Dept Appl Phys, Dhanbad 826004, Jharkhand, India.

   EMR/2016/005035.

PT J
AU Ilisca, E
AF Ilisca, Ernest
TI Electromagnetic nuclear spin conversion: Hydrogen on amorphous solid
   water
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MOLECULAR-HYDROGEN; H-2; METAL; ICE; EXCITATIONS
AB The interpretation of the conversion patterns of molecular hydrogen adsorbed on amorphous solid water confirms the electromagnetic nature of the process. Magnetic spin-orbit coupling and hyperfine contact introduce some electron spin-orbital excitation in the H-2-ASW ground state. The molecule-solid electron repulsion evacuates the H-2 rotation momenta. The theoretical rates fit the experimental ones in magnitude and steep temperature dependence. Fundamental discussion focus on the role of the surface electric field and on the dissipation of the rotational energy by the solid phonons.
C1 [Ilisca, Ernest] Univ Paris 07, Mat & Phenomenes Quant, F-75205 Paris 13, France.
   [Ilisca, Ernest] CNRS UMR 7162, F-75205 Paris 13, France.
RP Ilisca, E (reprint author), Univ Paris 07, Mat & Phenomenes Quant, F-75205 Paris 13, France.; Ilisca, E (reprint author), CNRS UMR 7162, F-75205 Paris 13, France.
